column1: #Text=Polycrystalline sample of Th7Fe3 was prepared from pure elements Th: 99.8% and Fe: 99.99%.
#Text=A two-step synthesis was carried out using an arc-melting under a Ti-gettered purified argon atmosphere.
#Text=First, the Th content was firstly melted separately and then impurities on the surface of the melted button were removed by mechanical cleaning and nitric acid etching.
#Text=Next, a mixture of the stoichiometric ratio 7:3 of Th and Fe was remelted several times to insure homogeneity.
#Text=The as-cast Th7Fe3 specimen was wrapped in tantalum foil, sealed into evacuated quartz tube and annealed at 800° for two weeks.

#Text=The quality of the Th7Fe3 sample was checked using powder X - ray diffraction (XRD) at room temperature, utilizing an X′Pert PRO diffractometer with monochromatized CuKα radiation (λ = 1.5406 Å) at the 2θ range of 10–90°.
#Text=The observed Bragg peaks in the XRD pattern indicate that the studied sample is highly homogeneous, crystallized in its own type hexagonal with the space group P63mc.
#Text=We are able to index all observed Bragg reflections with the lattice parameters a = b = 0.9849 nm and c = 0.6198 nm, being comparable to those previously reported16,42.

#Text=It is recalled that the crystal unit cell can be characterized by the three atomic positions for thorium atoms with Th1, Th2 located at two (6c) positions and Th3 at (2b) position and one position (6c) for iron atoms.

#Text=Specific heat C p (T) and electrical resistivity ρ(T) measurements were carried out in a Quantum Design PPMS with a 3He option in the temperature range 0.4–400 K and in magnetic fields up to 2 T.
#Text=The C p (T) data were collected using the relaxation-time technique and the two-tau model.
#Text=Heat capacity of sample platform with very small quantity of the apiezon N cryogenic grease was measured prior to the C p measurement.
#Text=The given values of the specific-heat have an uncertainty of less than 5%.
#Text=The ρ(T) data were measured using the standard ac four-probe method applying an alternating current of 1 mA with a frequency of 47 Hz.
#Text=The gold wires used as electrical contacts were bonded with a silver paste.
#Text=The error in the reported resistivity is about 10% mainly due to the presence of micro-cracks in the sample.
